contents:
Snippet Fish 1 2 3  function instantalpha convert $argv[1] -fuzz $argv[2]% -transparent $argv[3] $argv[1].alpha.png end   Bash 1 2 3  function instantalpha { convert "$1" -fuzz "$2"% -transparent "$3" "$1".alpha.png }    Usage 1 2 3 4  # file | source png, output will be .alpha.png # -fuzz distance | colors within this distance are considered equal # -transparent color | make this color transparent within the image instantalpha image.png 50 black    Requirements Make sure you have ImageMagick installed .
Add to Fish Copy and paste the above snippet into your shell. instantalpha is now available in your current session.
To make it persistent (save it), use the following Fish function, funcsave instantalpha
Add to Bash Add the function to your .bashrc or .bash_profile.
Demo    We have the classic “hello mac” raster.
   No more background.
summary: Snippet Fish 1 2 3  function instantalpha convert $argv[1] -fuzz $argv[2]% -transparent $argv[3] $argv[1].alpha.png end   Bash 1 2 3  function instantalpha { convert "$1" -fuzz "$2"% -transparent "$3" "$1".alpha.png }    Usage 1 2 3 4  # file | source png, output will be .alpha.png # -fuzz distance | colors within this distance are considered equal # -transparent color | make this color transparent within the image instantalpha image.
title: Instant Alpha on PNG
